citation.article-title: Phenylobacterium lituiforme sp. nov., a moderately thermophilic bacterium from a subsurface aquifer, and emended description of the genus Phenylobacterium
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of Phenylobacterium Lingens et al. 1985
Cells stain Gram-negative, are non-spore forming straight to slightly curved rods, coccobacilli or cocci measuring 0·7–1·0×1·0–2·0 μm and occur singly, in pairs or short chains.
Filamentous cells tend to form in old cultures.
Species may be strict aerobes or facultative anaerobes and may be motile or non-motile.
Cells do not form sheaths or prosthecae and are not acid-fast.
The members of the genus grow on l-phenylalanine.
Based on the 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, members of this genus form a monophyletic group within the order Caulobacterales, subclass α-Proteobacteria of the class Proteobacteria.
The DNA base ratio is 65±1 mol% G+C.
The type species is Phenylobacterium immobile Lingens et al. 1985 (strain ET=DSM 1986T).
